intro: Breweria pickeringii var. angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf breweria, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to specific regions of North America. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. The plant features slender, upright stems with lance-shaped, dark green leaves that have a slightly hairy surface. Its small, clustered flowers are usually white or pale pink, and they bloom in late spring to early summer. The species is characterized by its unique leaf morphology and ecological niche, making it a distinctive member of the Apiaceae family.
